title: Coaches
text:
PaulSimonRiaCourtneyCharleyMitchPete


Every client is taken through an initial stage of their training programme individually by one of our experienced and enthusiastic instructors. At regular intervals each member will have a private consultation with one of our fully qualified instructors, who will devise an appropriate first training programme.
If you have any queries about training, then please feel free telephone or contact us on the social media streams above.



Paul


Paul Slythe Gym Manager / Director
Paul Slythe Qualifications B.A.W.L.A Trained, Lifefit 2000, Advanced Exercise Performance Level 3 UKA track and field, YMCA Level 3, Health and Safety and Appointed person.
About Me… I was lucky enough to represent England and Great Britian in our Athletic Teams from 1993 until 2003. My athletics blessed me with a lot of opportunities like meeting other people from all over the world. I have trained and raced in places I never dreamed I would go, for instance L.A to Kuala Lumpur.
I have competed and won medals at the major athletic events including World Championships, Commonwealth Games and the Europeans.
Now my athletic career is over, I am a partner at Bob Prowse Health Club after I had been working there for 10+ years. We specialise in training the individual as individuals.
Whether you are brand new to the gym environment or a competent athlete, we can help you with Losing weight, Core stability, Functional training, Athletic training or just general fitness and toning.





Simon


Simon Mercer
Qualifications:

10+ years of gym experience
BSc Sports Science
Gym Instruction
Personal Training
Crossfit Level 2
Kettlebells

About me… I had the opportunity to gain work experience with Paul and Ian while studying Sports Science at University back in 2010. Now, a few years later, I have worked my way up to a Senior Gym Instructor position and become a successful Personal Trainer.
I have extensive experience helping people from all areas of fitness, whether it’s for aesthetics, strength & conditioning, or general fitness. My approach focuses not only on training clients hard but also on ensuring they train smart. Although I can cater to clients with different fitness goals, my specialisation lies in strength and hypertrophy training, thanks to my background as a competitive rugby player and powerlifter.
After spending years in powerlifting and enjoying coaching, I successfully created the Bob Prowse Powerlifting Team, which competes frequently. In addition to Personal Training, I offer bespoke online coaching for various goals, including powerlifting, aesthetics, and strength & conditioning.
Working together, I believe I can help you achieve fast results while enjoying the process. Feel free to contact me personally and check out my Instagram @simonmercercoaching.



Simon2





Ria




Ria Dunmill
Level 2 Gym Instructor Level 3 Personal Trainer 6 years instructor experience Competitive bodybuilder
In my years of working in the fitness industry I have found my passion in helping women gain confidence in the gym, moving away from the quick fixes and pyramid schemes to help you fall in love with the process and realise its long term sustainability where in turn the effort will not seem a chore. You might think the gym is not for you but I can guarantee you have yet to find what gives you that buzz and along the way I can help you achieve that goal, whether it be that defined and toned look you are after or to purely focus on building your physical and mental strength.
My focus is weight training as I love how you can transform your body with hard work and consistency. I am personally a competitive bodybuilder at British level in the bikini category and along with 6 years PT experience I have worked with a range of women who want to feel and look strong whilst making it practical and sustainable for all levels of experience.
I am able to tailor programmes with specific goals that are adaptable for your lifestyle. As a mum I understand how to create that balance and make your goals attainable to create that physique you desire.
Watching my clients progress is why I love what I do. Building a strong rapour is key to success and I want you to feel comfortable with me and have full faith that I have your goals at the front!
I offer individual personal training sessions/block bookings, and online coaching to keep you motivated and accountable throughout your fitness journey.
You will find me in the gym Monday through to Saturday, both with clients or putting myself through it. To arrange a chat about your fitness journey why not pop in and we can get a plan of action in place. Riadunmill85@gmail.com 07791 167573



Ria2







Courtney


Courtney Welham
Level 2 Gym Instructor Level 3 Personal Trainer
Functional fitness has been the cornerstone of my journey, as my ethos revolves around the principle of training for longevity - ensuring that each session not only boosts performance but also equips you with the strength and stamina for everyday life.
We all have different goals, routines, and lifestyles so I tailor my coaching to ensure it fits with your unique needs. Together, we’ll strive to unlock the best version of yourself, both within and beyond the gym.
Whether you’re aiming to build strength, loose weight or enhance performance - I’m here to guide you every step of the way.
If you’re ready to embark on your fitness journey to unleash your full potential, please contact me on any of the following:
Email: coachcourtswelham@gmail.com Phone: 07572427159 Instagram: @courtney.welham



Courtney2







Charley


Charley Ashton
Level 2 Gym Instructor Level 3 Personal Trainer Bootcamp Owner & Instructor Spin Instructor
I spent many years as a competitive swimmer so I understand the dedication, discipline and commitment it takes to earn results.
I have been working as a personal trainer for over 8 years and trained all abilities & ages with their specific goals.
I am owner of 2 local bootcamps with hundreds of members, running military style sessions for groups of over 70 people. I’ve helped support & coach those with little to no experience within fitness to become fitter, stronger, faster & more confident versions of themselves.
For the last 6 years I’ve run a fitness retreat in Sotogrande in Spain where training covers anything from boxing, swimming, cycling & yoga in the sunshine.
I love to train a functional fitness style, from focusing in on form & technique in weight lifting but most love doing tough, challenging, hardcore workouts leaving you feeling that post session buzz & sweat!
As a mum and business owner I understand how life is hectic, busy and demanding but truly believe that an hour of you time can be so beneficial to both your physical & mental health.
My business ethos has always been healthy body & healthy mind.
Happy to meet for a free consultation to discuss your goals
07753 468895 Charley@bcuk.uk @chizzle_a @bootcampukmaidstone



Charley







Mitch


Mitch Mason
Qualifications
L2 gym instructor L3 personal trainer
L1 & L2 CrossFit
L1 & L2 British weightlifting 10yrs experience Early sporting back ground was based around MMA & boxing, I found my true passion was weightlifting which took me to the heights of the English Championships . This in turn made me become a strength & conditioning coach to help give back to the fitness community. For personal training:
Mitchmasonpersonaltrainer@gmail.com





Pete


Pete. Trained for over 50 years . Former Maidstone firefighter and 3 time British natural couples champion along wife my wife Odell in the 80s and 3rd in the natural heavyweight class British mens 1991. Several TV appearances in the 90s on the National Lottery assisting mystic meg and in Eastenders beating up Phil Mitchell. Also Mr May in the national firefighters calendar.

title: App
text:
Apple Store
Google Play Store

TrainingPathways





5Ss


You could study Sport Science and training methods for a lifetime but you do not need to as our instructors have a vast range of knowledge and experience in the industry.
If you need indivdual input to keep you on track, want to improve a specific area, or have reached a plateau with other programmes then choose the Coaches tab and get individual assessment and programme design.
If you are generally fit and well, do not have any medical conditions and are a newcomer to this type of physical training then choose the Pathways tab and follow a progressive programme from Level 1 Unit 1 or jump in at an appropriate level. Programmes are laid out week by week, day by day and exercise by exercise. There is an itroductory program to check your readiness for Level 1, it will help in deciding if you need individual advice. They are available as the Everfit app on your phone or other device using the store links at the top of the page.


Follow a pre defined programme that follows on from your induction training or a programme that improves a specific component of fitness.
As no assessment has been made of specific goals the initial Pathway programmes aim to train all areas. One way of doing this is to target the bio-motor abilities as shown in the diagram. The overlaps between each identifiable ability (Speed, Strength, Stamina, Suppleness, Skill) lead to variations that can each be targeted by a training Means (Free weights, body weight, dumbbells etc).
There is a limit to the amount of time before a training programme becomes familiar and the training gains plateau. This is often refered to in the books (on the theory shelf in the office) as a maximum macro-cycle being about 55 days. The Pathway programmes change the exercise / loading in a shorter timescale to avoid this problem. They are available in Levels that progress in exercise specificity and training load.
Find the Pathways programmes here:
Level 1 Unit 1 for 3 days a week
Level 1 Unit 1 for 6 days a week

title: Facilities
text:
GymRooms


A notable feature of Bob Prowse Health Club is the availability of additional facilities, which both complement and enhance the already high quality of service offered at this club.
These facilities include a fully equiped Main Gym, an Aerobic room, “War Room”, Massage and Physiotherapy rooms, Sauna and a Lounge with a Supplements bar. We work with a number of partners to provide these services. See the Practitioners page to view the current details.
See the gallery of photos below for an overview of our equipment and facilities.   


Rooms for hire.



Physio

title: Services
text:
PractitionersSupplementsClothing


We work in partnership with a range of Consultants to provide complimentary services. Here are the current partners:

BrettWillMarkMitch





Brett


Brett Cooper
Massage Therapist
BMC Therapies 07940 126384
brett@bmctherapies.co.uk





Will


Will Skinner BSc, MSST
info@willsinjuryrehab.co.uk
07835854023
Website
Sports Therapist with an interest in injury assessment and rehabilitation, and the goal of not only reducing pain but also with the focus to return to sport, bridging the gap between pain and performance. Experience ranging from working with athletes in David Lloyd’s clubs, to DFS and NHS Occupational Health. Sports Massage also available





Mark


Mark Heffernan
Chartered Physiotherapist
BSc (Hons) MCSP
07818 192745
I have been working at Bob Prowse for a few years now. Although Physiotherapy is my main occupation, I also treat patients using sports massage, back manipulation and acupuncture. I enjoy my job as it is extremely rewarding. I like to keep fit too, you can often find me training in the gym with headphones, in the zone!





Mitch


Mitch Mason
Mason’s Sport and Remedial Massage
Email: MSRM_therapy@outlook.com



Treatment Room







Training is demanding. It takes everything – time, money, patience and care. Although most of these things are general and you adapt your needs to your lifestyle there is one thing that quite often gets forgotten. Correct nutrition.
This can mean anything like a simple dietary adjustment, such as not so many biscuits and a little less sugar in your tea. To make sure that everything you use during a session is replaced, you may need to consume more protein to check that stores are topped up for the repairing phase. Joints need extra help to look after the serious athletes knees or the beginner with an injury, your macro and micro nutrients need to be replenished to keep the endless list of tiny changes occuring correctly and of course sometimes we all need that extra boost of energy or nudge of help with our metabolism!
Our most popular brands are Phd, Reflex, Powerbar, USN and Boditronics. We sell the entire range of each. If you are not sure what you need, then feel free to have a conversation with a member of staff on 01622 683388. To order you will need to make your payment upfront to a member of staff and it will be placed on the order sheet.



Supplements




Personalised Clothing Range
Style your way in or out of the gym!
To match your wonderful figure gained from working out, order an item of clothing that is your chosen colour, your chosen style, your chosen nickname, even the type of print can be decided by you!
We offer anything from training vests to jog bottoms or t-shirts to jumpers. Maybe you are looking for a personlised towel or sports drink bottle? The only desicion you need to make is what to have and how cool do you want it to look?!
Find a member of staff and they will hand you the catalogue or if you see someone wearing something you like, order one just like it.
Items can take up to about 10 days to be received, so don’t delay! Most items come in Small, Medium, Large, Extra Large and XXL. Want one for FREE??? We give away T-shirts for any members who introduce a new member for a year. It can be friend or family, anyone you like! It is our loyalty scheme!
So what T-shirt size are you?!
Call us now on 01622 683388 to book a visit or your free trial



Clothing

title: Facilities
text:
BarberGymRooms


The Barber Shop has been re-furbished and Kieran and Katie are taking appointments now. Call 07933 286 453. Book Online



Kieran





Katie


My name is Katie and I’ve worked here at the Old Oak Gentlemen’s Barbershop since January 2023. I qualified as a barber in 2017 after completing my training in Maidstone. I previously worked in the same shop from age 15 as the Saturday helper and this is where my love for barbering started. I knew I wanted to be a stylist one day. I get to meet so many new people day to day, as well as being able to create a trusting relationship with all my clients to ensure they always walk out looking and feeling their best! I am confident with all hairstyles from skin fades to scissor cuts and from toddlers to Seniors. I can take on a few new clients so don’t hesitate to check out my instagram (@katiesfades) and DM with any questions you may have.
 


A notable feature of Bob Prowse Health Club is the availability of additional facilities, which both complement and enhance the already high quality of service offered at this club.
These facilities include a fully equiped Main Gym, an Aerobic room, “War Room”, Massage and Physiotherapy rooms, Sauna and a Lounge with a Supplements bar. We work with a number of partners to provide these services. See the Practitioners page to view the current details.
See the gallery of photos below for an overview of our equipment and facilities.   


Rooms for hire.



Physio

title: Home
text:
HistoryStaffMembership Rates


After working in the Middle East Bob settled in Maidstone and opened a gym when doing such a thing was a bold new idea.
This was in the day when after a training session you retired to the bar to have a pint and smoke!
Bob was well known in the industry but his brother Dave having been the Green Cross Code man and Darth Vader was from the Dark Side.
Bob ran the gym from 1982 until 2003 when he retired. Paul Slythe, a GB International 400m runner and Ian Sage who had a background in martial arts and body building, took over the company.


Every client is taken through an initial stage of their training programme individually by one of our experienced and enthusiastic instructors. At regular intervals each member will have a private consultation with one of our fully qualified instructors, who will devise an appropriate first training programme.
If you have any queries about training, then please feel free telephone or contact us on the social media streams above.

Ian Sage (1972 - 2018)
Ian trained at the gym from 1985 and started working there in 1990 and became joint owner from 2003.
He competed in Martial Arts and Amateur Bodybuilding competitions.
Ian was such an important part of the gym and will always be part of it’s identity.
Loved and missed by all.
